messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] Software titles was new to this list: Hi!
messages.msgSnippet: Great resource! any others you would like to share would be wonderful. We have kids who love to use the computer often and a have a limited budget. Johanna ...
messages.messageBody:
Great resource! any others you would like to share would be wonderful. We have kids who love to use the computer often and a have a limited budget.
Johanna
 
----- Original Message -----
From: Julie Miller
To: Unschooling-dotcom@yahoogroups.com
Sent: Wednesday, March 28, 2001 10:23 AM
Subject: [Unschooling-dotcom] Software titles was new to this list: Hi!

Most of these titles are offered for free with shipping and handling at
www.unbeatabledeals.com , www.arcamax.com and several other free software
places I can't remember the links to.  Let me know if you need them and I'll
hunt them down...


Julie Miller in OK


Lisa wrote:
Collete take a look at these, some of them are old you might have to hunt
for them

Gizmos an Gadgets by the Learning Company.  3 of mine played this for hours
and hours. Science

The Logical Journey of the Zoombini's - Borderbund -  Outstanding math game,
with no numberes. I plaed with my kids.

Zap - edmark Sort of like Gizmos and Gadgets but slightly different topics
Not quite as good as G&G

Any of the Living Books -- He can hear books read in another language, mess
around with all the hidden things in the pictures.

ZooZillions and Carnival Countdown  -Edmark now bundled together as a *math
package*

Any and all of the Reader Rabbit programs.  They are a blend of phonics and
sight words.

That's all I can think of at the moment.

LisaKK
